    • Method Detail

      • paintLine

        void paintLine(java.awt.Graphics g,
               java.awt.Color col,
               Coordinate[] coords,
               int mode,
               int thickness)
        Paints a line string that connects the given geo coordinates. We have the folling modes
        • 0: points are not marked
        • 1: line points are marked by cicles but in low density - optimized for viewing
        • 2: all line pointes are marked by cicles
        • 3: line pointes are marked by numbers (with low density)
        Parameters:
        g - graphics to paint on
        col - color
        coords - line coordinates
        mode - mode, see above
        thickness - line thickness

      • paintPolygon

        void paintPolygon(java.awt.Graphics g,
                  java.awt.Color col,
                  Coordinate[] coords)
        Fills a polygon. The polygon is closed automatically, i.e. the last coordinate has not to be equals to the first.
        Parameters:
        g - graphics to paint on
        col - color
        coords - polygone coordinates

      • paintPolygon

        void paintPolygon(java.awt.Graphics g,
                  java.awt.Color col,
                  Coordinate[] coords,
                  int thickness)
        Fills a polygon. The polygon is closed automatically, i.e. the last coordinate has not to be equals to the first.
        Parameters:
        g - graphics to paint on
        col - color
        coords - polygone coordinates
        thickness - line thickness

      • paintMultipolygon

        void paintMultipolygon(java.awt.Graphics g,
                       java.awt.Color col,
                       java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate[]> shells,
                       java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate[]> holes,
                       int thickness)
        Fills a multi polygon with holes.
        Parameters:
        g - graphics to paint on
        col - color
        shells - shells coordinates
        holes - holes coordinates
        thickness - line thickness

      • paintFlag

        void paintFlag(java.awt.Graphics g,
               java.awt.Color col,
               Coordinate coord,
               java.lang.String text)
        Paints a flag symbol on the given geo coordinate. If text!=null, it will be printed below the flag.
        Parameters:
        g - graphics to paint on
        col - color
        coord - coordinate
        text - text

      • paintPositionMarker

        void paintPositionMarker(java.awt.Graphics g,
                         java.awt.Color col,
                         Coordinate coord,
                         int radius,
                         java.lang.String text,
                         double[] bar,
                         int[] barcol)
        Paints a circular position marker on the given geo coordinate. If text!=null, it will be printed at the position. If bar!=null, a colored bar indicates the values (i.e. 1, 2, 3 will paint a bar with 1/6, 1/3, 1/2)
        Parameters:
        g - graphics to paint on
        col - color
        coord - coordinate
        radius - radius
        text - text
        bar - bar values
        barcol - bar colors

      • paintText

        void paintText(java.awt.Graphics g,
               java.awt.Point pixel,
               java.awt.Color col,
               java.lang.String text)
        Draw a text at the given position.
        Parameters:
        g - graphics to paint on
        pixel - pixel
        col - color
        text - text

      • geo2Pixel

        java.awt.Point geo2Pixel(Coordinate geoCoord)
        Computes a pixel position for the given geo coordinate. This can be used to perform own paintings.
        Parameters:
        geoCoord - geo coordinate
        Returns:
        pixel coordinate
